body.p: Born April 10, 1804 in Sampson County, North Carolina. Moved to Rapides Parish, Louisiana in 1829. In Louisiana, he owned a Plantation. Moore was elected to Louisiana State House of Representatives in 1848. He was elected to Louisiana State Senate in 1856. Moore was a Democrat. He served on the education committee that helped to establish Louisiana State University and Agriculture and Mechanical College. Elected governor of Louisiana in 1859. Supported Secession. In May 1862, Moore and the state government relocated to Opelousas to evade Union forces in the state. Moore’s governorship ended in 1864, after which he returned to his plantation. He soon had to leave his plantation as Union forces were moving through and burned it. Moore died on June 25, 1876 in Alexandria, Louisiana.
